intro: Citharexylum flabellifolium, commonly known as the flabellifolium cithara, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is often found in sandy soils. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and birds, contributing to its ecological importance.
